intro: Sloanea inermis, commonly known as the white sloanea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Sloanea inermis typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its ecological significance lies in its role as a habitat and food source for various native wildlife species.
